game_description: Warplanes: Battles over Pacific opens the next chapter in aviation history. Become a World War II pilot and take part in the campaign against the Empire of Japan. The sequel to the hit Warplanes: WW1 Fighters, takes dogfight to a new level. Realistic graphics and intuitive controls enhance the gameplay experience. The new flight model will make you feel the power, speed and handling of the most popular American and Japanese aircraft. The technological leap between World War I and World War II made aviation the leading branch of the military and changed war forever... WW2 EXPERIENCE IN VR ● Lead the US to victory over Japan in the single player campaign. ● Play classic PvP multiplayer modes to face off against players from around the world. ● Have fun with friends by your side playing co-op missions. ● Take controls of 15 of the most iconic aircraft fighting over the Pacific. ● Adjust the game to your preferences thanks to 3 difficulty levels.
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil), Spanish (Spain), Ukrainian

review_2: This is absolutely one of the best games on Oculus Quest 2. The combat is great and there are many planes to choose from. Another cool feature is you can change the color and logos on the plane to make it your own. Graphics are great! I wanted to be a fighter pilot in real life then developed epilepsy so now I can never fly so this game has given me the chance to feel what it may have been like and it's as close as I'll ever get and I'm super thankful for that and to the developers. If you're into planes then please check this game out and I promise you won't regret it. It does take a bit to get used to but once you do your solid. I thought I would get sick because everyone says they get sick the first time but for me it wasn't to bad then the second day of playing I was perfect and no nausea. 10/10 I hope they end up making another game like this.
review_3: This is an amazingly-good flight combat simulator for VR, with great graphics and stutter-free action (in comparison to games played via PC airlink). It's a little arcadey in nature, but that is probably why it is so action-packed - once you start a mission, things happen thick and fast. Being arcadey, some of the flight physics aren't always realistic (eg I can do rudder-only flat turns at 50 feet to eliminate AA) but that just helps complete otherwise seemingly-impossible missions. As you upgrade to better aircraft, you can feel the difference in performance, and in missions, you can jump between aircraft in your squadron to utilise their different capabilities. One tip - the fast-paced 3 dimensional flight action can lead to nausea for some. My trick is to pretend I am actually in the aircraft, and tilt and turn my head as I move the aircraft about in the sky. If I climb, I tilt my head up. If I dive, I tilt my head down. Banking and turning right, I tilt and turn my head right etc. Thus what I see in the headset is matched with what I feel through the accelerometer mechanisms in my inner ears, and so there is no nausea. Works for me in every motion-based game
